response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<T> it = items.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.print(it.next() + " ");
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new iterator in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject with a key "name" and a value "John". I want to get the value of the key "name". I tried this: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString); String name = jsonObject.getString("name"); But it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.getString("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getString("name")
<<<code>>>: String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You're using the wrong method. You should use JSONObject.getString("name").
